instructions: ✅ Select the correct option (A, B, C, or D).
✅ Each question has only ONE correct answer.
✅ This quiz covers Java intro, syntax, data types, operators, input/output, and basic rules.
✅ Try without seeing answers first, then verify using the answer field.

questions.question: Java is a ______ language.
questions.details: Java is a high-level, object-oriented and platform-independent programming language.

questions.question: Who developed Java programming language?
questions.details: Java was developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems.

questions.question: Java code is first compiled into ______.
questions.details: Java compiler converts .java to bytecode (.class), which runs on JVM.

questions.question: Which component runs Java Bytecode?
questions.details: JVM (Java Virtual Machine) executes bytecode and provides platform independence.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to define a class in Java?
questions.details: The correct keyword is lowercase 'class'.

questions.question: Which method is the entry point of a Java program?
questions.details: Execution starts from: public static void main(String[] args)

questions.question: What is the correct signature of main method?
questions.details: The main method must be public, static, void, and accept String[] arguments.

questions.question: Which symbol is used to end a statement in Java?
questions.details: Semicolon ';' ends most Java statements.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Java keyword?
questions.details: println is a method, not a keyword.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to print output in Java?
questions.details: System.out.print() and System.out.println() are used for printing.

questions.question: What does System.out.println() do?
questions.details: println prints the output and moves cursor to next line.

questions.question: Which of these is a valid comment in Java?
questions.details: Java supports // single-line and /* ... */ multi-line comments.

questions.question: Which is a valid multi-line comment in Java?
questions.details: Multi-line comment uses /* ... */

questions.question: Which datatype is used to store whole numbers?
questions.details: int is used for storing integer/whole number values.

questions.question: Which datatype is used to store true/false values?
questions.details: boolean stores only true or false.

questions.question: Which datatype is used to store a decimal number?
questions.details: double is commonly used for decimal values in Java.

questions.question: Which datatype is used to store a single character?
questions.details: char stores one Unicode character (example: 'A').

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a primitive datatype in Java?
questions.details: String is a class (non-primitive/reference type).

questions.question: Which operator is used for addition?
questions.details: + is used for addition (also string concatenation).

questions.question: Which operator is used to compare equality of two values?
questions.details: == checks equality, while = assigns value.

questions.question: Which operator is used to assign a value?
questions.details: = assigns a value to a variable.

questions.question:
What is the output?
System.out.println(5 + 3);
questions.details: 5 + 3 is integer addition, output is 8.

questions.question:
What is the output?
System.out.println("5" + 3);
questions.details: "5" is a String, so + performs concatenation → "53".

questions.question: Which keyword is used to take input in Java?
questions.details: Scanner class is commonly used for input: new Scanner(System.in)

questions.question: Which package contains the Scanner class?
questions.details: Scanner is present in java.util package.

questions.question: Which statement creates a Scanner object?
questions.details: Correct object creation syntax: new Scanner(System.in)

questions.question: Which method reads an integer using Scanner?
questions.details: Scanner method for int input is nextInt().

questions.question: Which method reads a full line of text using Scanner?
questions.details: nextLine() reads full line including spaces.

questions.question: Which of these is a valid Java variable name?
questions.details: Variable can start with underscore, but not digit, dash, or keyword.

questions.question: Java is ________ (Choose the best answer).
questions.details: Java is primarily an Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) language.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to create an object in Java?
questions.details: Objects are created using 'new' keyword.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct about Java?

options.A: Java supports multiple inheritance using classes
options.B: Java supports multiple inheritance using interfaces

questions.details: Java doesn't support multiple inheritance using classes, but supports it using interfaces.

questions.question: Which of these is a correct output statement?
questions.details: Java uses System.out.println().

questions.question: Which one is an invalid String initialization?
questions.details: String uses double quotes, not single quotes.

questions.question:
What will be the output?
System.out.println(10 / 2);
questions.details: Integer division 10/2 gives 5.

questions.question:
What will be the output?
System.out.println(10 / 3);
questions.details: 10 and 3 are integers, so result is integer division → 3.

questions.question: Which of these is used to store multiple values of same type?
questions.details: Arrays store multiple values of same type in continuous memory.

questions.question: Which is the correct way to declare an array?
questions.details: Correct array declaration and creation uses new int[size].

questions.question: Which keyword is used to stop a loop in Java?
questions.details: break statement exits the loop immediately.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to skip current iteration of a loop?
questions.details: continue skips the current iteration and moves to the next.
